page.title: 04BARNSLEY CANAL,NEAR RYHILL
page.content: The Barnsley Canal from the river Calder east of Wakefield to Barnby Basin near Barnsley was completed in 1802 and carried mainly coal and corn until closure in 1953.It runs through much attractive countryside and 10 of the original 16 miles are still in water or unobstructed.Two short stretches run through the block;they provide opportunities for fishing,and woodland and towpath walks in Haw Park. The Barnsley Canal Group was formed in 1984 to press for restoration of the canal as far as Barugh.Some work within Barnsley has been done by Barnsley Trades Council Community Programme.Local authorities are sympathetic but a 'Four Council(WYCC, SYCC,WMDC,BMDC)Officer Group formed to consider the proposals is not yet able to offer financial help.
